title: Pink Ribbon Days
content:
This is close to Bickham Script, but not quite. Any assistance greatly appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090607101744im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PRD%20Logo_5610.gif)
author: gecko

comments.content:
Hi Nancy,  
welcome to Typophile!

Yes, this is Bickham Script Pro. Note that Bickham is an OpenType font with lots of alternate forms (it has 1700 glyphs, altogether). You can access them in a savvy application, like InDesign, Illustrator and others.  
F

Its probably from the opentype version. There is an alternate y like that in it. Looks like the kerned the ibbo of Ribbon in real tight for some reason. That’s not usually a good idea in connecting scripts.

This is Bickham Script. Some letterforms are alternates that you can see in the [Character map](http://web.archive.org/web/20090607101744/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ADT0005366#characters) at Veer. If you have OpenType savvy applications, like Illustrator or InDesign you can access all these characters.

- Mike Yanega
